abstract: Sales of the wrench took off after Mr. Brown got Sears to do a test sale — and after Mr. Brown agreed not to sell his wrench to Home Depot or Lowe’s.
snippet: Sales of the wrench took off after Mr. Brown got Sears to do a test sale — and after Mr. Brown agreed not to sell his wrench to Home Depot or Lowe’s.
lead_paragraph: The Times has published an article detailing how Dan Brown, inventor of the Bionic Wrench, wound up in a patent dispute with Sears, which has introduced a competing product, the Max Access.

headline.main: Could the Inventor of the Bionic Wrench Have Avoided This Fight?
